"The X Factor' has become a worldwide phenomenon and is unlike anything we've seen in America," says Mike Darnell , President of Alternative Entertainment, Fox Broadcasting Company. The British version is wildly entertaining, but also has a penchant for stirring up controversy. You never know what Simon Cowell has up his sleeve, and since he will be working both behind and in front of the camera, the country should brace itself to expect the unexpected. While we don't miss Simon Cowell on "American Idol" that much, this certainly throws a whole new twist on singing competitions in the U.S.
